definitions.definition: To build or form (something) by assembling parts .
examples: We constructed the radio from spares.
A wall constructed of random stones.

definitions.definition: To build (a sentence , an argument , etc.) by arranging words or ideas .
examples: A sentence may be constructed with a subject, verb and object.

definitions.definition: To draw (a geometric figure ) by following precise specifications and using geometric tools and techniques.
examples: Construct a circle that touches each vertex of the given triangle.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To build or form (something) by assembling parts .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , grammar ) To build (a sentence , an argument , etc.) by arranging words or ideas .
( transitive , geometry ) To draw (a geometric figure ) by following precise specifications and using geometric tools and techniques.
